reasoning: ASD is a lifelong neurodevelopmental condition; prevalence is the appropriate metric. Global estimates suggest 0.5-1.5% population prevalence. CDC ADDM Network (2005-2008) reported 1 in 150 children (~667 per 100k). Extrapolated to total population with adjustment for adult diagnosis, yielding ~8,500 per 100k globally. Geographic variation is significant due to differences in diagnostic criteria and access to services across regions.
source: CDC Autism and Developmental Disabilities Monitoring (ADDM) Network, 2008 report covering 2005 data
